_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The Buddha's instructions on the immersi: When this immersion due to mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated, it's peaceful and sublime, a deliciously pleasant meditation.
It disperses and settles unskillful qualities on the spot whenever they arise.
It's developed and cultivated when a mendicant sits down cross-legged, with their body straight, and focuses their mindfulness right there.
They breathe in mindfully and breathe out mindfully.
They practice observing letting go while breathing in and breathing out.
The actions of the mendicants (a causal: They committed themselves to developing the many different facets of the meditation on ugliness.
They became horrified, repelled, and disgusted with their body.
They looked for someone to slit their wrists.
Each day ten, twenty, or thirty mendicants slit their wrists.
